sen.j: 平 教盛（たいら の のりもり）は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Norimori was a warlord in the late Heian era.
TAIRA no Norimori was a warlord in the late Heian era.
TAIRA no Norimori was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「平安時代末期」用語集に従い修正the late Heian era → the late Heian period「武将」用語集に従い修正warlord → busho (Japanese military commander)

sen.j: 平忠盛の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Tadamori.
He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Tadamori.
He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Tadamori.

sen.j: 平清盛の異母弟。
sen.e: He was the younger half brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was the younger half-brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was the younger half-brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.

sen.j: 平通盛、平教経の父。
sen.e: His sons were TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Noritsune.
His sons were TAIRA no Michimori, and TAIRA no Noritsune.
His sons were TAIRA no Michimori, and TAIRA no Noritsune.

sen.j: 保元の乱、平治の乱で兄の清盛に従って戦う。
sen.e: He fought in the Hogen no ran (Hogen Revolt) and the Heiji no ran (Heiji Revolt) under his elder brother Kiyomori.
He fought in the Hogen no ran (Hogen Revolt) and the Heiji no ran (Heiji Revolt) under his elder brother, Kiyomori.
He fought in the Hogen War and the Heiji War under his elder brother, Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: 指示書入力要領に従い修正Hogen no ran (Hogen Revolt) → Hogen WarHeiji no ran (Heiji Revolt) → Heiji War

sen.j: 平氏政権の成立とともに栄達し、門脇宰相、門脇中納言と呼ばれた。
sen.e: As the Taira clan won power, he succeeded and was called 'Kadowaki Saisho (Chancellor lived at the gate of Rokuhara)' or 'Kadowaki Chunagon'.
As the Taira clan came into power, he achieved great success, and was called 'Kadowaki Saisho' (the Chancellor who resides at the gate of Rokuhara) or 'Kadowaki Chunagon'.
sen.cmt: grammar. no English for Kadowaki Chunagon? What is the significance of people addressing him with reference to Rokuhara? Is it that the seat of government had been in effect moved from Gosho? Perhaps an exlnation of this otherwise meaningless comment should be included.
sen.e: As the Taira clan came into power, he achieved great success, and was called 'Kadowaki Saisho' (prime minister who resides at the gate of Rokuhara) or 'Kadowaki Chunagon' (vice-councilor of state who resides at the gate of Rokuhara).
sen.cmt: 「宰相」 用語集の表記に修正the Chancellor→ prime minister「中納言」 統一リストの表記に従い、説明文を追記 (vice-councilor of state who resides at the gate of Rokuhara)

sen.j: 鹿ケ谷の陰謀事件では娘婿の藤原成経が罪に問われたため、その赦免に奔走した。
sen.e: In the event of the Shishigatani Conspiracy, as FUJIWARA no Naritsune who was Norimori's son-in-law was charged with plot, Norimori tried to get petition for mercy.
At the occasion of of the Shishigatani Conspiracy, as FUJIWARA no Naritsune, who was Norimori's son-in-law was implicated in the plot, Norimori petitioned the court for mercy.
At the occasion of of the Shishigatani Conspiracy, as FUJIWARA no Naritsune, who was Norimori's son-in-law was implicated in the plot, Norimori made efforts to petition the court for mercy.
sen.cmt: 「奔走した」の訳漏れmade efforts to を追記

sen.j: 治承・寿永の乱では主に後方の守りについた。
sen.e: In the Jisho-Juei War, mainly he provided logistic support.
In the Jisho-Juei War, he mainly provided logistic support.
In the Jisho-Juei War, he mainly provided logistic support.

sen.j: 一ノ谷の戦いで嫡男の通盛をはじめとする子どもたちを失う。
sen.e: Michimori and other sons died in the battle of Ichi-no-tani.
His lost his eldest son Michimori, and other sons as well in the battle of Ichi-no-tani.
His lost his eldest son Michimori, and other sons as well in the Battle of Ichi no tani.
sen.cmt: 指示書入力要領及び統一リスト（その他2009/7/22）に従い修正battle of Ichi-no-tani → Battle of Ichi no tani

sen.j: 壇ノ浦の戦いの敗戦の中で兄の経盛とともに入水した。
sen.e: Defeated in the naval battle of Dan-no-ura, Norimori committed a suicide by throwing himself into the sea with his brother Tsunemori.
After suffering defeat in the naval battle at Dan-no-ura, Norimori committed suicide, throwing himself into the sea along with his brother Tsunemori.
After suffering defeat in the naval Battle at Dan no ura, Norimori committed suicide, throwing himself into the sea along with his brother Tsunemori.
sen.cmt: 指示書入力要領及び統一リスト（その他2009/7/22）に従い修正battle of Dan-no-ura → Battle of Dan no ura

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Life
Life
Biography
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正Life → Biography

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）の保元の乱では兄清盛に従って戦っている。
sen.e: He fought in the Hogen no ran (Hogen Revolt) under his elder brother Kiyomori in 1156.
He fought in the Hogen War under his elder brother, Kiyomori, in 1156.
He fought in the Hogen War under his elder brother, Kiyomori, in 1156.

sen.j: 功により院の昇殿を許された。
sen.e: Because of the fame in the battlefield, he was permitted to access to the imperial court.
Because of his fame on the battlefield, he was permitted access to the Imperial court.
Because of his fame on the battlefield, he was permitted access to the Imperial court.

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）の平治の乱では清盛が後白河法皇と二条天皇を内裏から奪回して、内裏に籠る源義朝、藤原信頼を攻撃する際に、清盛の嫡男の平重盛、弟の頼盛とともに大将として六波羅を出撃。
sen.e: In the event of Heiji Revolt, while Kiyomori rescued Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo from the imperial palace and then attacked MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and FUJIWARA no Nobuyori who were shut up in the imperial palace, Norimori, TAIRA no Shigemori and Yorimori who were Kiyomori's sons made a sortie into Rokuhara as general.

During the fray of the Heiji Revolt, Kiyomori rescued Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo from the Imperial palace and then proceeded to attack MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and FUJIWARA no Nobuyori, who were barricaded in the Imperial palace; meanwhile, Norimori, Kiyomori's eldest son, along with his younger brothers TAIRA no Shigemori and Yorimori, served as commanding generals leading an attack on Rokuhara.

During the fray of the Heiji War in 1159, Kiyomori rescued Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo from the Imperial palace and then proceeded to attack MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and FUJIWARA no Nobuyori, who were barricaded in the Imperial palace; meanwhile, Norimori, Kiyomori's eldest son, along with his younger brothers TAIRA no Shigemori and Yorimori, served as commanding generals leading an attack on Rokuhara.
sen.cmt: 年号役漏れのため in 1159 を追記指示書入力要領に従い修正Heiji Revolt → Heiji War

sen.j: 重盛が侍賢門、頼盛が郁方門を攻撃し、敗走したみせかけて源氏を内裏からおびき出し、その間に内応者に陽明門を開けさせて内裏を占領する働きをした。
sen.e: While Shigemori and Yorimori attacked each of Jiken-mon Gate and Yuho-mon Gate, Norimori decoyed the Minamoto clan from the imperial palace, pretending to be routed, then, he made an intelligencer open the Yomei-mon Gate and occupied the imperial palace.

While Shigemori attacked the Jiken-mon Gate and Yorimori the Yuho-mon Gate, Norimori acted as a decoy by feignting that he was fleeing in retreat, drawing the troops of the Minamoto clan from the Imperial palace, after which he had a his man on the inside open the Yomei-mon Gate and took possession of the Imperial palace.

重盛が侍賢門、頼盛が郁方門を攻撃し、敗走したとみせかけて源氏を内裏からおびき出し、その間に内応者に陽明門を開けさせて内裏を占領する働きをした。While Shigemori attacked the Jiken-mon Gate and Yorimori the Yuho-mon Gate, Norimori acted as a decoy by feignting that he was fleeing in retreat, drawing the troops of the Minamoto clan from the Imperial palace, after which he had his man on the inside open the Yomei-mon Gate and took possession of the Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: 脱字敗走したみせかけて → 脱走したとみせかけて内応者 = 内通者（裏切り者）a を削除he had a his man → he had his man

sen.j: 退路を失った義朝は六波羅へ総攻撃をしかけるが、力尽きて敗走。
sen.e: As Yoshitomo had his retreat cut off, he attacked Rokuhara in full force but ran out of energy and escaped.
Seeing as his retreat was blocked, Yoshitomo attacked Rokuhara with all the forces at his command; however, they were soon exhausted, and made their escape.
Seeing as his retreat was blocked, Yoshitomo attacked Rokuhara with all the forces at his command; however, they were soon exhausted, and made their escape.

sen.j: 乱は清盛の勝利に終わった。
sen.e: Kiyomori won the Heiji Revolt.
The Heiji Revolt ends with Kiyomori the victor.
The Heiji War ended with Kiyomori the victor.
sen.cmt: 指示書入力要領に従い修正Heiji Revolt → Heiji War「終わった」時制の修正ends → ended

sen.j: 乱後、正四位下常陸介となっていたが、応保元年（1162年）9月15日_(旧暦)、二条天皇を廃して高倉天皇（後の高倉天皇）擁立を図った容疑のため解官される。
sen.e: After the Heiji Revolt, he was conferred Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Hitachi no suke, however, he was dismissed because he was charged with plotting against Emperor Nijo that Norimori backed up Emperor Takakura.

After the Heiji Revolt, Norimori was granted the court rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Hitachi no suke; however, he was dismissed from his post and stripped of his rank because he was implicated in a plot against Emperor Nijo, in which he was accused of attempting to have install Emperor Takakura (later to become Emperor Takakura) on the throne.

After the Heiji War, Norimori was granted the court rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Hitachi no suke (Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province); however, he was dismissed from his post and stripped of his rank on October 12, 1161 because he was implicated in a plot against Emperor Nijo, in which he was accused of attempting to have install Emperor Takakura (later to become Emperor Takakura) on the throne.
sen.cmt: （原文）「応保元年（1162年）9月15日_(旧暦)」アンダーバーを削除→ 応保元年（1162年）9月15日 (旧暦)「応保元年（1162年）9月15日 (旧暦)」 訳漏れon September 15, 1162 (old lunar calendar) を追記指示書入力要領に従い修正Heiji Revolt → Heiji War「常陸介」説明を追記 Hitachi no suke → Hitachi no suke (Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province)September 15, 1162 (old lunar calendar)→October 12, 1161に変更しました。

sen.j: これは後白河上皇と二条天皇との対立の巻き添えをくったもので、
sen.e: This caused by the confrontation between the retired Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo.
This state of affairs was brought about by the confrontation between the retired Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo.
This state of affairs was brought about by the confrontation between the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Nijo.
sen.cmt: 「後白河上皇」 統一リストに従い表記を修正the retired Emperor Goshirakawa → the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa

sen.j: 院に近い平時忠（清盛の義兄）や藤原成親も解官されている。
sen.e: At this time, TAIRA no Tokitada (Kiyomori's brother-in-law) and FUJIWARA no Narichica who were close to the retired Emperor were also dismissed.
At this juncture, TAIRA no Tokitada (Kiyomori's brother-in-law) and FUJIWARA no Narichica, who were close to the retired Emperor, were also dismissed.
At this juncture, TAIRA no Tokitada (Kiyomori's brother-in-law) and FUJIWARA no Narichica, who were close to the Retired Emperor, were also dismissed.
sen.cmt: 「院」 統一リストに従い表記を修正the retired Emperor → the Retired Emperor

sen.j: 翌年には能登国受領に復職している。
sen.e: The next year, Norimori was reinstated as zuryo of Noto Province (governor of Noto Province).
The next year, Norimori was reinstated, being appointed to the post of zuryo of Noto Province (governor of Noto Province).
sen.cmt: zuryo is yet another term transated as "governor"?
sen.e: The next year, Norimori was reinstated, being appointed to the post of zuryo (provincial governor) of Noto Province.
sen.cmt: 「能登国受領」 用語集の表記に修正後、文章を一部変更the post of zuryo of Noto Province (governor of Noto Province) →the post of zuryo (provincial governor) of Noto Province

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)3年（1168年）に正三位参議に進み、邸宅が六波羅の総門にあったことから門脇宰相と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Sangi, he was called as 'Kadowaki Saisho (Chancellor lived at the gate of Rokuhara)' because he lived near the main gate of Rokuhara.

He was promoted to the court rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Sangi, he was called as 'Kadowaki Saisho' (Chancellor lived at the gate of Rokuhara) because he lived near the main gate of Rokuhara.

In 1168, He was promoted to the court rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Sangi (councillor), he was called as 'Kadowaki Saisho' (Chancellor lived at the gate of Rokuhara) because he lived near the main gate of Rokuhara.
sen.cmt: 年号訳漏れのため in 1168, を追記「参議」 用語集の表記に従い、説明を追記Sangi → Sangi (councillor)

sen.j: 安元3年（1177年）4月、延暦寺大衆が院御所へ強訴に押し寄せたとき、警固に出動。
sen.e: In April 1177, when monks of Enryaku-ji Temple rose in a riot and surged in the imperial palace, Norimori guarded the imperial palace.
In April 1177, when monks from the Enryaku-ji Temple rose in riot and surged toward the imperial palace, Norimori guarded the imperial palace.
In May 1177, when monks from the Enryaku-ji Temple rose in riot and surged toward the ingosho (the retired Emperor's court), Norimori guarded the imperial palace.
sen.cmt: 「院御所」用語集の表記に修正imperial palace → ingosho (the retired Emperor's court)April →Mayに変更しました。

sen.j: 同年6月、鹿ケ谷の陰謀事件が発覚。
sen.e: In June 1177, the Shishigatani Conspiracy was exposed.
In June 1177, the Shishigatani Conspiracy was exposed.
In June 1177, the Shishigatani plot was exposed.
sen.cmt: 「鹿ケ谷の陰謀事件」 用語集の表記に修正the Shishigatani Conspiracy → the Shishigatani plotJune →Julyに変更しました。

sen.j: 首謀者は院近臣の藤原成親、西光、俊寛らで、このうちに成親の嫡男の藤原成経は教盛の娘婿だった。
sen.e: The masterminds were FUJIWARA no Narichika, Saiko and Shunkan, and Narichika's son FUJIWARA no Naritsune was Norimori's son-in-law.
The lead conspirators were FUJIWARA no Narichika, Saiko and Shunkan, and Narichika's son, FUJIWARA no Naritsune, who was Norimori's son-in-law.
The lead conspirators were FUJIWARA no Narichika, Saiko and Shunkan, and Narichika's son, FUJIWARA no Naritsune, who was Norimori's son-in-law.

sen.j: 娘は身重でもあり、困り果てた教盛は成経とともに清盛の元へ参り、寛大な処置を願ったが、清盛は対面すら許さず成経の断罪を命じた。
sen.e: At that time, as Norimori's daughter was pregnant, Norimori and Naritsune petitioned Kiyomori for mercy, however, Kiyomori sentenced to death by beheading without meeting them.

At the time, because Norimori's daughter was pregnant, Norimori and Naritsune petitioned Kiyomori for mercy; Kiyomori, however, would not even grant them an audience, and sentenced Naritsune to death by beheading.

At the time, because Norimori's daughter was pregnant, Norimori and Naritsune petitioned Kiyomori for mercy; Kiyomori, however, would not even grant them an audience, and sentenced Naritsune to death by beheading.

sen.j: これに対して、教盛は出家して隠遁するとまで言いだし、それならばとようやく成経の身柄を教盛に預けることを許した。
sen.e: Norimori increased pressure on Kiyomori telling him Norimori would enter the priesthood and renounce the world as if Kiyomori executed Naritsune, thus Kiyomori accepted that Norimori had Naritsune under his charge.

Norimori's reaction to this decision was to tell Kiyomori that he himself would renounce the world and become a Buddhist monk if Kiyomori were to execute Naritsune, whereupon Kiyomori finally relented, agreeing to put Naritsune under Norimori's charge.

Norimori's reaction to this decision was to tell Kiyomori that he himself would renounce the world and become a Buddhist monk if Kiyomori were to execute Naritsune, whereupon Kiyomori finally relented, agreeing to put Naritsune under Norimori's charge.

sen.j: 関係者の処罰が決まり、成経は備中国次いで遠く薩摩国鬼界ヶ島へ流されることになった。
sen.e: Carrying out the punishments, Naritsune was exiled to Bitchu Province, then to a remote island called Kikai ga-shima in Satsuma Province.
The punishment of the perpetrators was decided, with Naritsune being exiled to Bitchu Province, and then to a remote island called Kikai ga-shima in Satsuma Province.
The punishment of the perpetrators was decided, with Naritsune being exiled to Bicchu Province, and then to a remote island called Kikai ga-shima Island in Satsuma Province.
sen.cmt: 「備中国」用語集の表記に修正Bitchu → Bicchu「鬼界ヶ島」用語集の表記に修正Kikai ga-shima → Kikai ga-shima Island

sen.j: 娘婿のこと哀れに思う教盛は懐妊した中宮平徳子の安産祈願として大赦を願い出て、清盛もこれを許し、翌治承2年（1178年）に成経は赦免されて京へ帰った。
sen.e: Norimori petitioned Kiyomori to grant amnesty to Naritsune as a wish for safety delivery of Empress TAIRA no Tokuko, Kiyomori accepted it, thus the next year, in 1178, Naritsune was granted amnesty and came back to Kyoto.

Norimori, pitying his son-in-law, petitioned Kiyomori to grant amnesty to Naritsune as a gesture of magnanimity expressing his wish for the safe child birth of Empress TAIRA no Tokuko; Kiyomori accepted this petition, and in the following year, 1178, Naritsune was granted amnesty and returned to Kyoto.

Norimori, pitying his son-in-law, petitioned Kiyomori to grant amnesty to Naritsune as a gesture of magnanimity expressing his wish for the safe child birth of Empress TAIRA no Tokuko; Kiyomori accepted this petition, and in the following year, 1178, Naritsune was granted amnesty and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）5月、以仁王の挙兵計画が露顕。
sen.e: Prince Mochihito's plot of rising in arms was discovered in May, 1180.
Prince Mochihito's plot to rise in arms was discovered in May, 1180.
Prince Mochihito's plot to rise in arms was discovered in June, 1180.

sen.j: 園城寺に逃げ込んだ以仁王追討の大将の一人に任じられる（以仁王の挙兵）。
sen.e: Norimori was appointed as one of generals to kill Prince Mochihito who escaped to Onjo-ji Temple (Risen an army by Prince Mochihito).
Norimori was appointed as one of the generals to lead the mission to capture and execute Prince Mochihito, who had fled, taking refuge in Onjo-ji Temple (Prince Mochihito's rising under arms).
Norimori was appointed as one of the generals to lead the mission to capture and execute Prince Mochihito, who had fled, taking refuge in Onjo-ji Temple (Prince Mochihito's rising in arms).
sen.cmt: 「挙兵」rising under arms → rising in arms（出典 http://eow.alc.co.jp/rise+in+arms/UTF-8/）

sen.j: 治承5年（1181年）閏2月、兄の清盛が死去。
sen.e: In February, leap year 1181, Norimori's brother Kiyomori died.
In February 1181, a, leap year, Norimori's brother, Kiyomori died.
sen.cmt: what is the significance of the leap year?
sen.e: In February 1181, a, leap year, Norimori's brother, Kiyomori died.

sen.j: 平家は衰運に向かうことになる。
sen.e: The Taira family resulted in declining in strength.
This marked the start of the decline of status for the Taira clan.
This marked the start of the decline of status for the Taira family.
sen.cmt: 「平家」統一リストに従い修正the Taira clan → the Taira family

sen.j: 養和元年（1181年）10月、北陸道の情勢が不穏になると、教盛は兄弟の頼盛、経盛とともに洛中の守りを担当した。
sen.e: In October 1181, as Hokuriku-do Street became unstable situation, Norimori and his brothers Yorimori and Tsunemori guarded inside the capital Kyoto.
In October 1181, faced with increasing unrest along the Hokuriku-do Highway, Norimori, along with his brothers Yorimori and Tsunemori secured themselves inside the capital, Kyoto.
In November 1181, faced with increasing unrest along the Hokuriku-do Road, Norimori, along with his brothers Yorimori and Tsunemori secured themselves inside the capital, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 「北陸道」用語集の表記に修正Hokuriku-do Highway → Hokuriku-do RoadOctober →Novemberに変更しました。

sen.j: 嫡男の通盛は越前国守で北国の守りを担当しており、源義仲の軍と合戦を繰り返していた。
sen.e: As his son Michimori was the governor of Echizen Province who was in charge of defense of northern districts, he had fought with MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
As his son, Michimori, was the governor of Echizen Province and was in charge of defense of northern provinces, he had repeatedly engaged the forces of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in battle.
As his son, Michimori, was the governor of Echizen Province and was in charge of defense of northern provinces, he had repeatedly engaged the forces of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in battle.

sen.j: 養和2年（1182年）、従二位権中納言に進み、門脇中納言と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: In 1182, promoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Chunagon, he was called 'Kadowaki Chunagon (Vice chief councilor lived at the gate of Rokuhara)'.

In 1182, Norimori was promoted to the court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Chunagon, after which he was came to be called 'Kadowaki Chunagon (the Vice chief councilor who resides at the gate of Rokuhara)'.

In 1182, Norimori was promoted to the court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), after which he was came to be called 'Kadowaki Chunagon' (vice-councilor of state who resides at the gate of Rokuhara).
sen.cmt: 「権中納言」統一リストの表記に訂正Chunagon → Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state)「門脇中納言」統一リストの表記に修正Chunagon (the Vice chief councilor → Chunagon (vice-councilor of stateハイフンの位置を変更 'Kadowaki Chunagon (vice-councilor of state who resides at the gate of Rokuhara)'→ 'Kadowaki Chunagon' (vice-councilor of state who resides at the gate of Rokuhara)

sen.j: 一門都落ち
sen.e: Leaving the capital of the Taira family
Departure of the Taira family from the capital
Flight of the Taira family from the capital
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に従い修正Departure → Flight

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）4月から5月にかけて、平維盛を総大将とする北陸遠征軍が源義仲に敗れて壊滅。
sen.e: From April to May 1183, Hokuriku expeditionary force led by the supreme commander TAIRA no Koremori was defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
In fighting from April to May 1183, the Hokuriku expeditionary force under the command of TAIRA no Koremori was defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
In fighting from April to May 1183, the Hokuriku expeditionary force under the command of TAIRA no Koremori was defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.

sen.j: 嫡男の通盛も敗走して京へ逃げ帰った。
sen.e: Norimori's son Michimori also escaped to Kyoto.
Norimori's son Michimori was also routed, and escaped to Kyoto.
Norimori's son Michimori was also routed, and escaped to Kyoto.

sen.j: 同年7月、平家は京を支えきれなくなり、ついに都落ちする。
sen.e: In July 1183, the Taira family was unable to keep the capital Kyoto and left.
In July 1183, it became impossible for the Taira clan to hold the capital, Kyoto, so they left.
In July 1183, it became impossible for the Taira family to hold the capital, Kyoto, so they left.
sen.cmt: 「平家」統一リストに従い修正the Taira clan → the Taira family

sen.j: 平家は讃岐国屋島に本営を置き、教盛・通盛・教経の父子は同年閏10月の水島の戦いに参戦し勝利する。
sen.e: The Taira family set the headquarter in Yashima District, Sanuki Province, Norimori, his sons Michimori and Noritsune fought in the battle of Mizushima in October 1183 and they won.

The Taira clan set up headquarters in Yashima District, Sanuki Province, and in October 1183, Norimori, along with his sons Michimori and Noritsune, took part in the battle of Mizushima, emerging victorious.

The Taira family set up headquarters in Yashima, Sanuki Province, and in November 1183, Norimori, along with his sons Michimori and Noritsune, took part in the Battle of Mizushima, emerging victorious.
sen.cmt: 「平家」統一リストに従い修正the Taira clan → the Taira family「讃岐国屋島」Yashima District, Sanuki Province → Yashima, Sanuki Province「水島の戦い」用語集の表記に修正battle of Mizushima → Battle of MizushimaOctober →Novemberに変更しました。

sen.j: さらに、同年11月の室山の戦いでは平重衡とともに大将軍として出陣し源行家を破っている。
sen.e: Then, in November 1184, Norimori fought in the battle of Muroyama as general along with TAIRA no Shigehira, and defeated MINAMOTO no Yukiie.
Then, in November 1184, Norimori took part in the battle of Muroyama as a commanding general along with TAIRA no Shigehira, and they defeated the army of MINAMOTO no Yukiie.
Then, in December 1183, Norimori took part in the Battle of Muroyama as a commanding general along with TAIRA no Shigehira, and they defeated the army of MINAMOTO no Yukiie.
sen.cmt: 「同年11月」in November 1184 → in November 1183November →Decemberに変更しました。

sen.j: 翌寿永3年（1184年）正月、義仲は鎌倉から派遣された源範頼・源義経に滅ぼされた。
sen.e: In January 1184, Yoshinaka was defeated by MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune who were sent from Kamakura government.
In January 1184, Yoshinaka was defeated by MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune who had been dispatched by the Kamakura bakufu.
In February 1184, Yoshinaka was defeated by MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune who had been dispatched by the Kamakura bakufu ('Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「鎌倉から」統一リストに従い、bakufu に説明文を追加January →Februaryに変更しました。

sen.j: 平家は摂津国福原京まで進出し、教盛父子は西国の反乱勢力の鎮圧にあたり、特に次男の教経は華々しく戦った。
sen.e: During the Taira family advanced to Fukuwara-kyo District, Settsu Province, Norimori and his sons subdued rebel groups in western districts, especially, his second son Noritsune fought outstandingly.

Meanwhile, the Taira family had advanced to Fukuwara-kyo District, Settsu Province, and Norimori and his sons subdued rebel groups in western districts, especially, with Norimori's second son, Noritsune, being said to have fought valiantly.

Meanwhile, the Taira family had advanced to Fukuwara-kyo District, Settsu Province, and Norimori and his sons subdued rebel groups in western districts; especially, Norimori's second son, Noritsune, fought valiantly.
sen.cmt: 「特に次男の教経は華々しく戦った」セミコロンを追記し、being said to have を削除especially, with Norimori's second son, Noritsune, being said to have fought valiantly →; especially, Norimori's second son, Noritsune, fought valiantly.fought valiantly

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）2月4日、福原で清盛の法要が営まれ、除目が行われ（平家は安徳天皇と三種の神器を擁しているので除目を行う権利がある）、教盛は正二位大納言に叙されるが、これを辞退した。
sen.e: On February 4, 1184, the Buddhist memorial service for Kiyomori's death and 'Jimoku' (appointing service, the Taira family had right to held the Jimoku because they had Emperor Antoku and three sacred emblems of the imperial family) were held in Fukuhara District, and Norimori was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and Dainagon (Chief councilor), however, he refused the promotion.

On February 4, 1184, a Buddhist memorial service for Kiyomori's death, and a Jimoku ceremony (a ceremony at which officials are appointed, the Taira family had right to conduct the Jimoku ceremony because they had Emperor Antoku, and the three sacred treasures of the Imperial family were in their possesssion) were held in Fukuhara District, with the court rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and the post of Dainagon (Chief councilor) being conferred on Norimori; however, he declined to accept the rank and post.

On March 24, 1184, a Buddhist memorial service for Kiyomori's death, and a Jimoku ceremony (a ceremony at which officials are appointed, the Taira family had right to conduct the Jimoku ceremony because they had Emperor Antoku, and the three sacred treasures of the Imperial family were in their possession) were held in Fukuhara District, with the court rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and the post of Dainagon (Chief councilor) being conferred on Norimori; however, he declined to accept the rank and post.
sen.cmt: スペル修正possesssion → possession February 4→March 24に変更しました。

sen.j: その日、範頼・義経の鎌倉軍が京を進発していた。
sen.e: On the same day, Kamakura government armies led by Noriyori and Yoshitsune left Kyoto.
On the same day, Kamakura bakufu armies under the command of Noriyori and Yoshitsune left Kyoto.
On the same day, Kamakura bakufu armies under the command of Noriyori and Yoshitsune left Kyoto.

sen.j: 7日に行われた福原を巡る一ノ谷の戦いで平家は惨敗し、嫡男の通盛をはじめ、子の教経、業盛がみな討ち死にした（教経については生存説あり）。
sen.e: On February 7, the Taira family was defeated in the battle of the Ichi-no-tani, his sons Michimori, Noritsune, Narimori died in battle, (as for Noritsune, he was said to survive the battle.)

On February 7, the Taira family was defeated in the battle of Ichi-no-tani, at which Norimori's sons Michimori, Noritsune, and Narimori met their deaths on the battlefield, (it is said that Noritsune survived the battle.)

On February 7, the Taira family was defeated in the Battle of Ichi no tani, at which Norimori's sons Michimori, Noritsune, and Narimori met their deaths on the battlefield (it is said that Noritsune survived the battle).
sen.cmt: 「一の谷の戦い」指示書入力要領及び統一リスト（その他2009/7/22）に従い修正the battle of Ichi-no-tani → the Battle of Ichi no tani括弧とピリオドの位置を修正battlefield, (it is said that Noritsune survived the battle.)→ the battlefield (it is said that Noritsune survived the battle).

sen.j: さらに、身重だった通盛の妻の小宰相も夫の後を追って入水自殺してしまう。
sen.e: Kozaisho, who was Michimori's wife and pregnant, threw herself into the sea.
Kozaisho, who was Michimori's wife and was pregnant, threw herself into the sea, committing suicide.
Kozaisho, who was Michimori's wife and was pregnant, commited suicide by drowning after her husband died.
sen.cmt: 「夫の後を追って」訳漏れのため、文章を一部修正threw herself into the sea, committing suicide → commited suicide by drowning after her husband died

sen.j: 子たちを失った教盛の身辺は心細いものになった。
sen.e: Norimori lost his children and he became insecure.
Norimori, having lost his children, felt increasingly apprehensive and insecure.
Norimori, having lost his children, felt increasingly apprehensive and insecure.

sen.j: その後、平家は屋島の戦いに敗れ、長門国彦島に逃れた。
sen.e: After that, the Taira family was defeated in the battle of Yashima, then escaped to the Hiko-jima Island, Nagato Province.
Subsequently, the Taira family was defeated in the battle of Yashima, and escaped to the Hiko-jima Island, Nagato Province.
Subsequently, the Taira family was defeated in the Battle of Yashima, and escaped to the Hiko-shima Island, Nagato Province.
sen.cmt: 「屋島の戦い」用語集の表記に修正the battle of Yashima → ｔhe Battle of Yashima「彦島」用語集の表記に修正Hiko-jima Island → Hiko-shima Island

sen.j: そして元暦2年（1185年）3月、壇ノ浦の戦いが行われ、平家は力尽きて敗北。
sen.e: In March 1185, the battle of Dan-no-ura took place and the Taira family was defeated.
In March 1185, the battle of Dan-no-ura took place, at which the Taira clan, having exhausted itself, suffered a final defeat and was vanquished.
In April 1185, the Battle of Dan no ura took place, at which the Taira clan, having exhausted itself, suffered a final defeat and was vanquished.
sen.cmt: 用語集に従い修正the battle of Dan-no-ura → the Battle of Dan no uraMarch →Aprilに変更しました。

sen.j: 二位尼（清盛の妻）と安徳天皇をはじめ、平家の一門は次々と入水した。
sen.e: Most Taira family, such as Nii no Ama (Kiyomori's wife) and Emperor Antoku threw themselves into the sea.
Most members of the Taira family, starting with Nii no Ama (Kiyomori's wife) and Emperor Antoku, threw themselves into the sea.
Most members of the Taira family, starting with Nii no ama (Kiyomori's wife) and Emperor Antoku, threw themselves into the sea.
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/7/22) に従い修正Nii no Ama → Nii no ama

sen.j: 教盛は兄の経盛とともに鎧の上に碇をつなげて兄弟手を取りあって海に沈んだ。
sen.e: Norimori and his elder brother Tsunemori threw themselves into the sea together, tying their armors with anchor.
Norimori and his elder brother, Tsunemori, tied anchors to their armor, clasped one another's hand, and cast themselves into the sea together.
Norimori and his elder brother, Tsunemori, tied anchors to their armor, clasped one another's hand, and cast themselves into the sea together.

sen.j: 享年58。
sen.e: He was 58 years old.
Norimori was 58 years old.
Norimori died at the age of 58.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正was 58 years old → died at the age of 58

sen.j: 官歴
sen.e: Official Career
Official Career
Record of office and rank
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に修正Official career → Record of office and rank（trans 2 のコメントが抜けています）

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: * Date = Chinese calendar
* Date = Chinese calendar
* Date = old lunar calendar
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正Chinese Calendar → old lunar calendar以下を新暦に変更したため削除しました。

sen.e: In 1148 (21 years old)
The year 1148 (21 years old)
1148 (21 years old)
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正The year 1148 → 1148

sen.j: 正月28日左近衛将監。
sen.e: January 28, Sakone no shogen
January 28: Appointed to the post of Sakone no shogen
sen.cmt: grammar, format? Need consitent format, why are all of these different?
sen.e: February 26: Appointed to the post of Sakone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards)
sen.cmt: 「左近衛将監」用語集の表記に従い(Lieutenant of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) を追加January 28→February 26に変更しました。

sen.j: 鳥羽院判官代
sen.e: Toba-in hogandai
Appointed to the post of Toba-in hogandai
Appointed to the post of Tobain hogandai (an administrative official of the retired Emperor Toba's Office)
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に従い、ハイフンを削除Toba-in hogandai → Tobain hogandai説明を追加(an administrative official of the retired Emperor Toba's Office)

sen.j: 2月5日蔵人
sen.e: February 5, keeper of imperial archive.
February 5: Appointed to the post of keeper of imperial archives
March 4: Appointed to the post of keeper of imperial archives

sen.j: 4月26日従五位下
sen.e: April 26, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
April 26: Promoted to the court rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
May 22: Promoted to the court rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
In 1151 (24 years old)
The year 1151 (24 years old)
1151 (24 years old)

sen.e: February 2, Awaji no kami (Governor of Awaji Province)
February 2: Appointed to the post of Awaji no kami (Governor of Awaji Province)
February 26: Appointed to the post of Awaji no kami (Governor of Awaji Province)
In 1153 (26 years old)
The year 1153 (26 years old)
1153 (26 years old)

sen.j: 正月5日従五位上（崇徳上皇御給）
sen.e: January 5, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), (the retired Emperor Sutoku, to be given.)
January 5: Promoted to the court rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), (granted by the retired Emperor Sutoku)
February 7: Promoted to the court rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), (granted by the retired Emperor Sutoku)

sen.e: In 1157 (30 years old)
the year 1157 (30 years old)
1157 (30 years old)
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正The year 1157 → 1157

sen.j: 10月22日正五位下（陰明門の造営）
sen.e: October 22, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) (Built Inmei-mon Gate).
October 22: Promoted to the court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), in recognition of his having overseen the construction of the Inmei-mon Gate
December 2: Promoted to the court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), in recognition of his having overseen the construction of the Inmei-mon Gate
In 1158 (31 years old)
The year 1158 (31 years old)
1158 (31 years old)

sen.j: 4月2日左馬権頭兼任
sen.e: April 2, Samagon no kami concurrently.
April 2: Appointed to the post of Samagon no kami, held concurrently with his other posts
May 8: Appointed to the post of Sama gon no kami (Provisional Captain of Samaryo, Left Division of Bureau of Horses), held concurrently with his other posts

sen.j: 12月29日大和守。
sen.e: December 29, Yamato no kami (Governor of Yamato).
December 29: Appointed to the post of Yamato no kami (Governor of Yamato)
January 27, 1159: Appointed to the post of Yamato no kami (Governor of Yamato Province)

sen.j: 左馬権頭如元
sen.e: Sanagon no kami, as it was.
Retained the post of Sanagon no kami
Remained in the position of Sama gon no kami (Provisional Captain of Samaryo, Left Division of Bureau of Horses)

The year 1159 (32 years old)
1159 (32 years old)

January 3: Promoted to the court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)
January 30: Promoted to the court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 12月27日越中守（平治の乱の勲功）。
sen.e: December 27, Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu), (because of deed of valor in the Heiji Revolt.)
December 27: Appointed to the post of Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu), in recognition of his valor in the Heiji Revolt
February 13, 1160: Appointed to the post of Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), in recognition of his valor in the Heiji War

Retained the post of Samagon no kami
Remained in the position of Sama gon no kami

The year 1160 (33 years old)
1160 (33 years old)

January 2: Appointed to the post of Hitachi no suke (Vice governor of Hitachi Province)
March 7: Appointed to the post of Hitachi no suke (Vice governor of Hitachi Province)

Remained in the position of Sama gon no kami

sen.j: 6月3日従四位上（兄・清盛が、肥前国住人・通能を追討）
sen.e: June 3, Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) (because his brother Kiyomori killed Michiyoshi (通能) who lived in Hizen Province.)
June 3: Promoted to the court rank of Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), in recognition of his brother Kiyomori's having killed Michiyoshi (通能), who lived in Hizen Province
July 15: Promoted to the court rank of Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), in recognition of his brother Kiyomori's having killed Michiyoshi (通能), who lived in Hizen Province

1161 (34 years old)

sen.j: 正月11日丹波権守兼任
sen.e: January 11, Tanba gon no kami (governor of Tanba Province)
January 11: Appointed to the post of Tanba gon no kami (governor of Tanba Province)
February 16: Appointed to the post of Tanba no gon no kami (provisional governor of Tanba Province)
sen.cmt: 「丹波権守」用語集の表記に従い、表記を修正及び説明を追記Tanba no gon no kami (provisional governor of Tanba Province)January 11→February 16に変更しました。

sen.e: In 1174 (47 years old)
The year 1174 (47 years old)
1174 (47 years old)
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従い修正The year 1174 → 1174

sen.j: 正月21日丹波権守重任
sen.e: January 21, reappointed to Tanba gon no kami.
January 21: Reappointed as Tanba gon no kami
March 3: Reappointed as Tanba no gon no kami (provisional governor of Tanba Province)
sen.cmt: 「丹波権守」用語集の表記に従い、表記を修正及び説明を追記Tanba no gon no kami (provisional governor of Tanba Province)January 21→March 3に変更しました。

1178 (51 years old)

Resigned as Tanba no gon no kami
sen.cmt: 「丹波権守」用語集の表記に従い、表記を修正Tanba gon no kami → Tanba no gon no kami

sen.e: April 5, Chunagon
